abstract: A professional boxer turned designer discusses his respected men's-wear line.
snippet: A professional boxer turned designer discusses his respected men's-wear line.
lead_paragraph: Suffice it to say that, in Japanese, Arashi Yanagawa's first name means "big storm." The son of a taxi driver, Yanagawa made a name for himself as a professional boxer over a four-year career that included winning the Japanese national championships. Having satisfied his father's deepest aspirations for his son, Yanagawa moved on to his new passion: fashion design. With no schooling or training, he simply started making clothes, founding the brand John Lawrence Sullivan (named after the Irish boxer) and learning as he went. Seven years later, JLS is one of the more respected men's-wear companies in Japan and Yanagawa maintains a solid reputation as an excellent designer. Now, he is turning his sights on men's-wear for women.
